description: This walk crosses a largely overlooked and underestimated area of west London and looks at some landmark architectural sites as well as a number of surprising Modernist-style gems.

factsheet.heading: About the tour and guide
paragraphs: This tour will examine the social and economic factors that drove Bayswater's first wave of development in the 19th century, its subsequent experience in the 20th century and some current developments. The walk looks at some landmark architectural sites as well as a number of surprising Modernist-style gems.
Guide: Adrian Gibbs is a Londoner who has spent a lifetime looking at the city and loves to share his passions with others on the streets of the city.

factsheet.heading: Golden Key Academy
paragraphs: This tour is led by a participant of Open City’s Golden Key Academy – a course training up insightful and engaging guides dedicated to explaining London and bringing its many stories to life. It is part of a wider collection of tour events created by Golden Key Academy guides for the Open House Festival celebrating their conclusion of the six month course.
Further info on the Golden Key Academy https://open-city.org.uk/golden-key-academy

travel_info: Tube: Bayswater, Queensway, Paddington, Lancaster Gate

name: A walk through Bayswater
